data.title: Information Center
data.text:
Issues on cases under examination through the procedure of simplified proceedings discussed with advocates

13/11/2018

According to Director of the "Centre for Legislation Development and Legal Research" Foundation of the Ministry of Justice Tigran Markosyan, although representatives of the Chamber of Advocates were also present during the recent discussion on this Draft and were among several other interested parties, this meeting was organised upon being informed that several advocates also have proposals regarding the draft Law.

Read more...

Artak Zeynalyan urges Deputy Prosecutor General of Azerbaijan to properly consider internal corruption issues

13/11/2018

During the anti-corruption conference held in Rome, touching upon the statement of Representative of the Azerbaijani Delegation and Deputy Prosecutor General Kamran Aliyev, according to which "there is misapplication of legislation, corruption risks in the occupied territories and it is impossible to implement anti-corruption measures there", Acting Minister of Justice of the Republic of Armenia Artak Zeynalyan announced about this and advised the Azerbaijanis to properly deal with internal corruption issues.

Read more...

OSCE to assist Armenia in implementing large-scale reforms in the anti-corruption sector

13/11/2018

Artak Zeynalyan underlined the persistence and intolerance of the Government of the Republic of Armenia in the fight against corruption and presented to his counterpart the recent developments in the anti-corruption sector.

Read more...

Vigen Kocharyan presents in Washington DC the reforms under implementation in the judicial-legal sector in Armenia

09/11/2018

During the conference, Vigen Kocharyan touched upon the implemented and envisaged projects for reforms in the human rights protection sector and the judicial-legal sector in Armenia, as well as presented the developments in relation to implementation of the Sustainable Development Goals in Armenia, including the progress achieved by the Republic of Armenia in the processes of nationalisation and implementation of the 17 Goals included in the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development.

Read more...

Suren Krmoyan: "Civil society and the Government must be the co-implementers of the reforms in Armenia"

07/11/2018

He emphasised that the OGP is the tool that makes it possible to engage civil society in the process of implementing reforms in the public administration system. "A relevant toolkit is required to turn the vote of confidence given to the Government by citizens into tangible results and to implement necessary reforms based on that vote of confidence ,"

Read more...

Issues on establishing a common practice for application of penalties discussed with representatives of credit organisations

06/11/2018

Director of the "Centre for Legislation Development and Legal Research" Foundation of the Ministry of Justice of the Republic of Armenia Tigran Markosyan, representatives of the Central Bank and experts of the Foundation also participated in the meeting.

Read more...

Ministry of Justice discusses perspectives of co-operation with USAID

05/11/2018

During the meeting, the parties touched upon the long-term and strong partnership between the Ministry of Justice and the USAID. In this context, Artur Hovhannisyan highly appreciated the support of the Agency to the reforms being implemented in a number of sectors in Armenia and viewed the jointly implemented projects as successful.

Read more...

Professional discussion on improvement of cases under examination through the procedure of simplified proceedings

03/11/2018

Among the participants of the discussion were First Deputy Minister of Justice of the Republic of Armenia Artur Hovhannisyan; member of the Supreme Judicial Council Sergey Meghryan; Director of the Foundation Tigran Markosyan; judges of the Court of Cassation, the Civil Court of Appeal and the first instance courts of general jurisdiction of the city of Yerevan and marzes, as well as representatives from the Ministry of Finance, the Central Bank, the Union of Banks of Armenia, the Staff of the Human Rights Defender of the Republic of Armenia, the Chamber of Advocates, the "Centre for Legislation Development and Legal Research" Foundation of the Ministry of Justice of the Republic of Armenia and civil society representatives.

Read more...
